title.narrative: EVAC AND DI PREVENTION AND RESPONSE SERVICES

description.narrative: The capacities of central and local authorities to plan, regulate, resource and oversee child protection prevention and response services are increased for addressing institutionalization and violence against children., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable, are protected from all forms of violence, abuse, neglect and abject poverty and increasingly utilize quality, integrated social protection services, and parents and caregivers change their attitudes and behaviours on violence against children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The capacities of central and local authorities to plan, regulate, resource and oversee child protection prevention and responseservices are increased for addressing institutionalization and violence against children.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued strengthening the social service workforce in the education, health and social protection sectors and among CSOs to develop case management skills and competencies for the prevention of violence and social orphanhood and to address difficult life situations of children. Service provision to children affected by migration was strengthened with the support of the Human Rights Ombudsperson, Children’s Rights Protection Committee, EU and CSOs. The dialogue between the Ombudsperson for Children, government, parliament, UNICEF and CSOs has led to a decision to strengthen alternative forms of family care in order to prevent the institutionalization of children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022
